transcript.title: NORTHERN IRELAND PEACE AGREEMENT
transcript.content:
I welcome the announcement that agreement has been reached on a peace

settlement for Northern Ireland.

This historic achievement holds out the prospect for an end to the

bitter sectarian strife which has divided and afflicted the people

of Northern Ireland for so many decades.

I congratulate the two Prime Ministers, Mr Blair and Mr Ahern, and

the chairman of the peace talks, Mr George Mitchell, for their vision

and determination in encouraging the parties to make the compromises

necessary to reach a principled and fair outcome.

The Australian government urges all the parties and the people of

Northern Ireland and Ireland to seize this opportunity to ensure a

just and lasting settlement, to put behind them the years of violence

and despair and to build a future of peace and tolerance for their

children.

11 April 1998
